resources.string: This is not a functional SMS app.

The base functionality requires just the READ_SMS permission, but only inbox and sent messages can be seen by non-default apps on Marshmallow and above.\n\n(An app can\'t revoke its own permission, so turning this off has to be handled manually in Settings.)
Alternatively, temporarily setting adbsms as the default SMS app will allow access to the other types – draft, failed, etc. – but you will lose all messaging functionality in the meantime.
